title: Vegan Ratatouille with Polenta
description: A vibrant, rustic ratatouille of roasted eggplant, zucchini, peppers and tomatoes simmered with garlic and herbs, served over creamy, lemony polenta. Bright herbs and a splash of balsamic elevate the vegetables while coarse polenta provides comforting texture for a satisfying plant-based meal.

ingredients.notes: cut into 1-inch cubes, skin on or peeled per preference

ingredients.display_name: zucchini, medium, cut into 1/2-inch rounds or half-moons
red bell pepper, seeded and cut into 1-inch pieces
yellow or orange bell pepper, seeded and cut into 1-inch pieces
tomatoes, ripe plum or roma, chopped (or canned crushed tomatoes)
ingredients.notes: or use 1 x 14 oz (400 g) canned crushed tomatoes as substitute

ingredients.display_name: onion, yellow or sweet, medium, diced

ingredients.notes: divided: for roasting and for finishing

ingredients.display_name: fresh basil leaves, chopped (plus extra for garnish)
fresh thyme leaves (or 1 tsp dried thyme)

ingredients.notes: use coarse or medium grind polenta/cornmeal

ingredients.display_name: water or vegetable broth for polenta
ingredients.notes: ratio 4:1 liquid to cornmeal for creamy polenta
zest 1 lemon and use 1 tbsp juice

steps.text: Preheat oven to 425°F (220°C). Toss cubed eggplant with 1 tablespoon olive oil and 1/2 teaspoon salt on a rimmed baking sheet, spread in a single layer.
Roast the eggplant in the preheated oven until golden and tender, turning once halfway through to ensure even browning.
Meanwhile, heat 2 tablespoons olive oil in a large sauté pan over medium heat. Add diced onion and a pinch of salt and cook until translucent, stirring occasionally.
Add minced garlic and chopped bell peppers to the pan; sauté until peppers begin to soften, then add zucchini and cook until zucchini is just tender.

Stir in chopped tomatoes (or canned crushed tomatoes), roasted eggplant, balsamic vinegar, fresh thyme, half the basil, remaining salt and pepper, and pour in vegetable broth. Bring to a gentle simmer.
Simmer the ratatouille uncovered, stirring occasionally, until vegetables are melded and sauce is slightly reduced—adjust seasoning and add red pepper flakes if desired.
While ratatouille simmers, bring the polenta liquid (water or broth) to a boil in a medium saucepan. Slowly whisk in the cornmeal to avoid lumps.
Reduce heat to low and cook polenta, stirring frequently, until thickened and creamy—about 8–10 minutes for medium-ground polenta (longer for coarse grind).
Stir lemon zest, lemon juice, nutritional yeast (if using), 1 tablespoon olive oil, and a pinch of salt into the cooked polenta. Taste and adjust seasoning.

Fold remaining fresh basil into the ratatouille off the heat and finish with a drizzle of olive oil. Spoon creamy polenta onto plates or a shallow bowl and top with ratatouille. Garnish with extra basil and freshly ground black pepper.
